data.name: Glitchy
data.description:
Glitchy is a community token which was community launched back on May 16, 2021. 
The token was created on the Binance Smart Chain, where buyers & sellers get taxed on each transaction, which profits all Glitchy holders. A part of the tax goes toward increasing liquidity, and another part gets reflected to all holders. A percentage of this also goes to the maintenance wallet, which well help grow the project via marketing and development, while another percentage gets sent to the contract BNB balance. The BNB balance gets distributed to all holders weekly!

What Makes Glitchy Unique?

Glitchy has it's own App to do the BNB reward process which can be opened in Dapps.

Ownership is required in order for the contract to work. The owner can start and stop the claims cycles. No minting functions exist in the contract. The Glitchy total supply can therefore only go down from now on and the owner can't create any more tokens. 

Glitchy aims to balance stability and utility – We aim to strengthen our reward system and identify areas for improvement to benefit our holders. We also plan to formulate exchange and token tracker in to directly buy Glitchy or BSC tokens in the future with just the use of our credit/debit cards. We will also be looking towards acquiring a position on several larger volume exchanges (i.e., kucoin, bittrex, hotbit). 

How Many Glitchy Coins Are There in Circulation?

On its launch, Glitchy produced 1 Quadrillion tokens. 80% of the supply was added to PancakeSwap against 0.5 BNB, 10% were burned and 10% remained on the deployer's wallet.
      
Of the deployed wallet holdings, 15% is now burnt. 

Where Can I Buy Glitchy (Glitchy)?

Glitchy can be bought using the Binance Smart Chain via Pancakeswap V2 Defi with 12-15% Slippage.

[Binance](https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/binance/) offers the largest number of pairs as of October 2020, while [Huobi Global](https://coinmarketcap.com/exchanges/huobi-global/) also offers [Bitcoin](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/bitcoin/) (BTC), [Ethereum](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/ethereum/) (ETH) and [Tether](https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/tether/) (USDT) options.

New to cryptocurrency? Read CoinMarketCap’s [easy guide](https://coinmarketcap.com/how-to-buy-bitcoin/) to buying Bitcoin or any other token.
